meta.dc:title: HR 3889 ENR: ONDCP Technical Corrections Act of 2019
meta.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
meta.dc:creator: Xcential BillDTD to USLM Converter v20200824
meta.property: One Hundred Sixteenth Congress of the United States of America
To amend the Office of National Drug Control Policy Reauthorization Act of 1998 to make technical corrections.

main.name: HR3889

content.p: To amend the Office of National Drug Control Policy Reauthorization Act of 1998 to make technical corrections.

main.enactingFormula: Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the United States of America in Congress assembled,

section.heading: Short title.
section.content: This Act may be cited as the “ONDCP Technical Corrections Act of 2019”.

subsection.heading: Office of National Drug Control Policy Reauthorization Act of 1998 Technical Corrections.—
subsection.chapeau: The Office of National Drug Control Policy Reauthorization Act of 1998 (21 U.S.C. 1701 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.content: by striking “National Drug Control Program Agency” and inserting “National Drug Control Program agency” each place it appears;
by striking “National Drug Control Program Agencies” and inserting “National Drug Control Program agencies” each place it appears;
in section 702(15), by striking “tribal” each place it appears and inserting “Tribal”;

clause.content: in paragraph (4), by striking “program,” and inserting “programs,”; and
in paragraph (6), by striking “High-Intensity” and inserting “High Intensity”; and

subparagraph.content: in subsection (d), by striking “chapter” each place it appears and inserting “title”;

subclause.content: in clause (i), by striking “section 704(c)(4)” and inserting “subsection (c)(5)”; and
in clause (iv), by striking “section 704(j)” and inserting “subsection (j)”; and

by striking “The Director shall determine whether the coordinator position is a noncareer” and inserting “For purposes of carrying out the previous sentence, the Director shall designate or appoint an”; and
by striking “a career” and inserting “an”;

subparagraph.content: in subsection (b)(21)(A)(iii), by striking “chapter” and inserting “title”;

clause.content: in paragraph (2)(A)(ii), by striking “fo” and inserting “of”;

subclause.content: in subclause (I), by striking “subparagraph (A)” and inserting “clause (i)”; and
in subclause (II), by striking “clause (i)” and inserting “subclause (I)”; and

by striking “The Director shall determine whether the coordinator position is a noncareer” and inserting “For purposes of carrying out subparagraph (A), the Director shall designate or appoint an”; and
by striking “a career” and inserting “an”;

item.content: in clause (iii), by moving subclauses (I) through (V) 2 ems to the left so that the left margin of such clause is aligned with the margin of clause (iii);
by moving clause (iii) 2 ems to the left so that the left margin of such clause is aligned with the margin of subparagraph (E); and
by redesignating clause (iii) as subparagraph (F); and
by redesignating subclauses (I) through (V) as clauses (i) through (v), respectively; and
in clause (v), as so redesignated, by striking the period at the end and inserting a semicolon; and

clause.content: in paragraph (9), by striking “section 704(f)(5);” and inserting “subsection (f)(5); and”; and

by striking “The Director shall determine whether the coordinator position is a noncareer” and inserting “For purposes of carrying out the previous sentence, the Director shall designate or appoint an”;
by striking “a career” and inserting “an”; and

subparagraph.content: in subsection (d)(1), by striking “that every” and inserting “than every”; and

subclause.content: in subparagraph (A)(i), by striking the semicolon at the end and inserting “; and”; and

item.content: by inserting “that may impede applicants” after “barriers”; and
by striking “impediments” and all that follows through “agencies”; and

clause.content: in paragraph (2), in the heading, by striking “drug control” and inserting “drug control program”;

paragraph.content: in section 707(o)(2)(B), by striking “802(33))” and inserting “802(33)))”; and

clause.content: in the heading, by inserting “and continuing” before “threats”;

by striking “The Director shall determine whether the coordinator position is a noncareer” and inserting “For purposes of carrying out the previous sentence, the Director shall designate or appoint an”; and
in paragraph (3)(F), by striking “response of” and inserting “response to”; and
in paragraph (4)(B)(iii), by inserting “the” before “plan, where”; and

subparagraph.content: in subsection (f)(1), by striking “subtitle” and inserting “subsection”.

subsection.heading: Repeal of annual report requirement.—
subsection.chapeau: The Office of National Drug Control Policy Reauthorization Act of 2006 (Public Law 109–469; 120 Stat. 3502) is amended—

paragraph.content: in section 1(c), in the table of contents, by striking the item relating to section 203.

subsection.heading: Technical correction to the Substance Abuse Prevention Act of 2018.—

paragraph.heading: Amendments.—
paragraph.chapeau: The Substance Abuse Prevention Act of 2018 (subtitle K of title VIII of Public Law 115–271) is amended—

subclause.content: in the heading, by striking “National Narcotics Leadership Act of 1988” and inserting “Anti-Drug Abuse Act of 1988”;
in paragraph (1), by striking “the National Narcotics Leadership Act of 1988” and inserting “subtitle A of title I of the Anti-Drug Abuse Act of 1988”;
by striking paragraph (3);
by redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (3); and
in paragraph (3)(A), as so redesignated, by striking “National Narcotics Leadership Act of 1988” and inserting “Anti-Drug Abuse Act of 1988”;
in the heading, by striking “National Narcotics Leadership Act of 1988” and inserting “Anti-Drug Abuse Act of 1988”;
in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking “National Narcotics Leadership Act of 1988” and inserting “Anti-Drug Abuse Act of 1988”; and

in paragraph (4)(B), by striking “in section 1032(b)(1)(A) (21 U.S.C. 1532(b)(1)(A)), by striking clause (iii) and inserting the following” and inserting “by amending section 1032(b)(3)(D) (21 U.S.C. 1532(b)(3)(D)) to read as follows”; and

clause.chapeau: in the quoted matter added by subsection (b)(4)(B)—

subclause.content: in clause (iii), by moving subclauses (I) and (II) 2 ems to the left so that the left margins of such subclauses are aligned with the margin of clause (iii);
by moving clause (iii) 2 ems to the left so that the left margin of such clause is aligned with the margin of subparagraph (B) of subsection (b)(4);
by redesignating clause (iii) as subparagraph (D); and

item.content: by redesignating subclauses (I) and (II) as clauses (i) and (ii), respectively; and
in clause (ii), as so redesignated, by striking “tears” and inserting “years”; and

clause.content: in the quoted matter added by subsection (a), by striking “‘Sec. 706. National drug control strategy.”; and

in subsection (a), by striking “amended to read as follows:” and inserting“amended—“(1) by striking subsections (a) and (b);“(2) by redesignating subsections (c) and (d) as subsections (h) and (i), respectively; and“(3) by inserting before subsection (h), as so redesignated, the following:”.

paragraph.heading: Effective date.—
paragraph.content: The amendments made by this subsection shall take effect as if included in the enactment of the Substance Abuse Prevention Act of 2018 (subtitle K of title VIII of Public Law 115–271).

paragraph.heading: Matching requirement revived and restored.—
paragraph.content: Section 1032(b)(1)(A)(iii) of the Anti-Drug Abuse Act of 1988 (21 U.S.C. 1532(b)(1)(A)) is revived and restored as if the amendment made by section 8203(b)(4) of the Substance Abuse Prevention Act of 2018 (subtitle K of title VIII of Public Law 115–271) had never been enacted.

subsection.heading: Additional technical corrections to the Office of National Drug Control Policy Reauthorization Act of 1998.—
subsection.chapeau: Section 706 of the Office of National Drug Control Policy Reauthorization Act of 1998 (21 U.S.C. 1701 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.content: in clause (ii), by striking “Programs” and inserting “Program agencies”; and
in clause (iii), by striking “Agencies” and inserting “Program agencies”;

paragraph.content: in subsection (c)(2), in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking “paragraph (1)” and inserting “paragraph (1)(M)”;

subparagraph.content: in paragraph (2), by striking “office” and inserting “Office”; and

clause.content: in subclause (III), by striking the semicolon at the end and inserting “; and”; and
in subclause (IV), by striking the semicolon at the end and inserting a period; and

paragraph.content: in subsection (g)(3), in subparagraph (B), by striking “chapter;” and inserting “title;”.

subsection.heading: Administration of grant.—
subsection.chapeau: Section 4 of Public Law 107–82 (21 U.S.C. 1521 note) is amended—

subparagraph.content: by striking “The Director” and inserting “Beginning in fiscal year 2020, the Director”; and
by striking “, using amounts authorized to be appropriated by subsection (d),”; and

paragraph.content: by amending subsection (d) to read as follows:“(d) Administration of grant.—“(1) Duration.—With respect to a grant made under subsection (a) in fiscal year 2020, the term of the grant shall be 4 years.“(2) Disbursement.—To the extent amounts are provided in appropriation Acts for such grant, the Director shall disburse the amount of the grant made under subsection (a) on an annual basis.”.

signature.role: Speaker of the House of Representatives.
Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate.
